intro: Rosa chlorigabrielssonii, commonly known as the Chlorine Gabrielsson Rose, is a rare and unique species within the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its pale yellow to greenish foliage, which gives it its distinctive name. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that bloom in late spring, typically in shades of white and pale pink. It is native to a specific region in South America and is adapted to grow in shaded, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
